column1:
share on x da dalia ayala. jun 13 at 5:31 pm we love you dad. we are blessed to know that your not suffering anymore. you will be missed! your legacy is your family! i remember when you thought that the leal's were going to finish /end, but we are so many and still more to be born. we will see you in heaven, it is your turn to drink coffee with your mamasita and all who went before you! love from the leal-ayala family! comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x sm sunny mendozajun 13 at 2:26 pm lit a candle in memory of natividad g. leal. comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x more memories... currently no events are scheduled. no medias to show. 365 days of grief support. subscribe corpus christi funeral home website designed by funeralone contact obituaries about store 
show less view & service share facebook twitter google+ post now light a candle virtual gifts yellow rose periwinkle blue green red dove angel heart hug butterfly roses hands in prayer bible sunshine teddy american flag veteran rosary gardener interlocked rings catholic cross football baseball golf sailboat firefighter non catholic cross basketball police buddha hockey coach soccer star of david canadian flag menorah memories events media share a memory of natividad g. leal ma mariselva. jun 14 at 7:31 am it's ironic how you never fully appreciate someone or something, until they or it are gone. my grandfather was and still is essential to the person that i am. he blessed me with my name, he (in his special way) taught me to never give up, he is part of my dna. his legacy will live on through all of us who are blessed to know and love him. he is missed tremendously! love, mariselva. comment share comment share facebook twitter 
natividad g. leal| home obituaries flowers & gifts grief & healing plan ahead resources about contact corpus christi funeral home
